docs.title: DRF API Client
docs.text:
A Kotlin Multiplatform library for working with the unofficial Drop Research Facilities (DRF) API.

The library is fully written in common Kotlin code. Prebuilt binaries are available for JVM (Java 11 or later), JS, Wasm, and several native targets.1

[!WARNING] This library uses internal APIs that are not officially supported by the DRF developers and may break at any time.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
First, create a DrfApiClient instance to start using the library.

val drfApiClient = DrfApiClient()

This library uses Ktor for networking. By default, a reasonable default will be picked for the underlying engine. However, in some cases, it might be desirable to customize the engine.

This can be achieved by using one of the constructor overloads. For example, the following code explicitly configures the API client to use the CIO engine.

val drfApiClient = DrfApiClient(CIO)

docs.title: Subscribing to live messages
docs.text:
The subscribe function of the API client can be used to retrieve a "cold" flow that returns live messages from the DRF API when collected.

val drfApiClient = ...
drfApiClient.subscribe(apiToken = "")
    .onEach { println(it) }
    .collect()

docs.title: Supported platforms
docs.text:
The following targets are supported by this library:

Target platform Target preset Kotlin/JVM (can also be used on Android) jvm Kotlin/JS js Kotlin/Wasm wasmJs iOS iosArm64, iosX64, iosSimulatorArm64 watchOS watchosArm32, watchosArm64, watchosX64, watchosSimulatorArm64 tvOS tvosArm64, tvosX64, tvosSimulatorArm64 macOS macosArm64, macosX64 Linux macosArm64, macosX64 Windows linuxArm64, linuxX64 Windows mingwX64

  1. We aim to provide prebuilt libraries for all native targets supported by Ktor. Despite that, some targets may be missing as target support may change over time. In case something is missing, please make sure to let us know. ↩
